title: A 45-year-old Male with Hip Pain
clinical_history: A 45-year-old male, John, presented with a 3-week history of right hip pain. He reports that the pain started after a sudden increase in his running routine. He describes the pain as deep and aching in the groin area, with intermittent sharp pain when he moves his hip in certain positions or bears weight on it.
aggrevating_factors: Running, jumping, climbing stairs, and prolonged standing or sitting
picture: A 45-year-old male with visible discomfort in the right hip and groin area
easing_factors: Rest, ice, and over-the-counter pain medication
past_history: History of osteoarthritis in his family, with his mother having undergone hip replacement surgery
medical_history: Generally healthy, but has high cholesterol and hypertension
medications: Occasional use of ibuprofen for pain relief
personal_history: Married with two children, works as an accountant, and enjoys running and hiking in his free time
imaging: X-rays of the right hip and pelvis show mild joint space narrowing and osteophytes
